remarks.format: ## Remarks 泛型类是具有 O (log n) 检索的二进制搜索树，其中 n 是字典中的元素数。The generic class is a binary search tree with O(log n) retrieval, where n is the number of elements in the dictionary. 在这一方面，它是类似于泛型类。In this respect, it is similar to the generic class. 这两个类具有相似的对象模型，并且都具有 O (log n) 检索。The two classes have similar object models, and both have O(log n) retrieval. 两个类的不同之处是在内存使用和插入和删除的速度：Where the two classes differ is in memory use and speed of insertion and removal: - 使用更少的内存比。 uses less memory than . - 具有更快地插入和删除操作的未排序的数据： O (log n) 而不是为 o （n） 。 has faster insertion and removal operations for unsorted data: O(log n) as opposed to O(n) for . - 如果从已排序的数据，同时填充列表快于。If the list is populated all at once from sorted data, is faster than . 可以将每个键/值对的形式进行检索结构，或作为通过非泛型接口。Each key/value pair can be retrieved as a structure, or as a through the nongeneric interface. 键必须是不可变，只要它们被用作键在。Keys must be immutable as long as they are used as keys in the . 中的所有密钥必须是唯一的。Every key in a must be unique. 密钥不能`null`，但值则可以为，如果类型值`TValue`是引用类型。A key cannot be `null`, but a value can be, if the value type `TValue` is a reference type. 需要一个比较器实现，以执行关键的比较。 requires a comparer implementation to perform key comparisons. 您可以指定的一个实现泛型接口使用的构造函数接受`comparer`参数; 如果未指定一个实现，默认 genericcomparer使用。You can specify an implementation of the generic interface by using a constructor that accepts a `comparer` parameter; if you do not specify an implementation, the default genericcomparer is used. 如果类型`TKey`实现泛型接口，则默认比较器使用该实现。If type `TKey` implements the generic interface, the default comparer uses that implementation. `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 返回集合中的元素的类型的对象。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) returns an object of the type of the elements in the collection. 由于每个元素的是一个键/值对，元素类型不是键的类型或值的类型。Since each element of the is a key/value pair, the element type is not the type of the key or the type of the value. 相反，元素类型是。Instead, the element type is . 下面的代码演示 C#、 c + + 和 Visual Basic 语法。The following code shows C#, C++, and Visual Basic syntax. remarks.format: ## Remarks 对于枚举而言，每个项都是结构，它表示包含值和其键。For purposes of enumeration, each item is a structure representing a value and its key. `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 字典中使用的内部树的排序顺序维护。The dictionary is maintained in a sorted order using an internal tree. 每个新元素放置在正确的排序位置处并对树进行调整时移除元素时维护排序顺序。Every new element is positioned at the correct sort position, and the tree is adjusted to maintain the sort order whenever an element is removed. 枚举，时维护排序顺序。While enumerating, the sort order is maintained. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置上，未定义属性。At this position, the property is undefined. 因此，您必须调用方法将枚举数前移到集合，然后再读取的值的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call the method to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 属性返回的相同元素直到调用方法。The property returns the same element until the method is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合，枚举器的末尾放置在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举数位于此位置上，对后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 无法再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素；必须改为创建新的枚举器实例。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator instance instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果进行了更改到集合中，例如添加、 修改或删除元素，该枚举数将失效且不可恢复，并且下次调用或引发。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 命名空间中集合的默认实现是不同步的。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized. 此方法是 O (log n) 操作，其中 n 是计数。This method is an O(log n) operation, where n is count.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 命名空间中集合的默认实现是不同步的。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这可能会导致枚举器引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which can cause the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. 属性返回一个对象，可用于同步对。The property returns an object that can be used to synchronize access to the . 同步是所有线程访问集合之前都锁定的对象时才有效。Synchronization is effective only if all threads lock the object before accessing the collection. 获取此属性的值是 o （1） 操作。Getting the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 对于枚举而言，每个项都是结构。For purposes of enumeration, each item is a structure. `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 方法也会枚举数放回此位置。The method also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，您必须调用方法将枚举数前移到集合，然后再读取的值的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call the method to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 属性返回同一个对象，直到或调用。The property returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合，枚举器的末尾放置在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举数位于此位置上，对后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果进行了更改到集合中，例如添加、 修改或删除元素，该枚举数将失效且不可恢复，并且下次调用或引发。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 命名空间中集合的默认实现是不同步的。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized. 此方法是 O (log n) 操作，其中 n 是集合中的元素数。This method is an O(log n) operation where n is a number of elements in a collection. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何通过使用枚举字典中的键/值对`foreach`语句 (`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中`for each`c + + 中)，从而隐藏了枚举器的使用。The following code example shows how to enumerate the key/value pairs in the dictionary by using the `foreach` statement (`For Each` in Visual Basic, `for each` in C++), which hides the use of the enumerator. 具体而言，请注意，枚举数接口返回对象而非对象。In particular, note that the enumerator for the interface returns objects rather than objects. 代码示例摘自一个更大的示例，包括输出中，为提供方法。The code example is part of a larger example, including output, provided for the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 具有固定大小的集合在创建之后不能再添加或移除元素，但是允许修改现有元素。A collection with a fixed size does not allow the addition or removal of elements after the collection is created, but it allows the modification of existing elements. 具有固定大小的集合只是一个集合与防止添加和移除元素; 的包装器因此，如果在更改基础集合，包括添加或删除的元素，大小固定集合反映了这些更改。A collection with a fixed size is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents adding and removing elements; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, including the addition or removal of elements, the fixed-size collection reflects those changes. 获取此属性的值是 o （1） 操作。Getting the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在创建只读集合后，该集合不允许添加、移除或修改元素。A collection that is read-only does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements after the collection is created. 集合是只读的只是一个集合与可防止修改集合; 的包装器因此，如果对基础集合进行更改，只读集合反映了这些更改。A collection that is read-only is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents modifying the collection; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, the read-only collection reflects those changes. 获取此属性的值是 o （1） 操作。Getting the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性，可以通过使用下面的 C# 语法访问集合中的特定元素： `myCollection[key]` (`myCollection(key)`在 Visual Basic 中)。This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following C# syntax: `myCollection[key]` (`myCollection(key)` in Visual Basic). 此外可以使用属性来添加新元素不存在的键的值设置在字典中; 例如， `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`。You can also use the property to add new elements by setting the value of a key that does not exist in the dictionary; for example, `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`. 但是，如果在字典中已存在指定的键，则将设置属性将会覆盖旧值。However, if the specified key already exists in the dictionary, setting the property overwrites the old value. 与此相反，方法不会修改现有元素。In contrast, the method does not modify existing elements. 使用 C# 语言[这](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/this.md)关键字来定义而不是实现索引器属性。The C# language uses the [this](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/this.md) keyword to define the indexers instead of implementing the property. Visual Basic 将 实现为默认属性，该属性提供相同的索引功能。Visual Basic implements as a default property, which provides the same indexing functionality. 获取此属性的值是 O (log `n`) 操作; 属性设置也是 O (log `n`) 操作。Getting the value of this property is an O(log `n`) operation; setting the property is also an O(log `n`) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用的属性 （C# 中的索引器）与，以及方法的属性不同于属性。The following code example shows how to use the property (the indexer in C#) of the interface with a , and ways the property differs from the property. 该示例表明，，喜欢属性，属性可以更改与现有密钥关联的值，可以使用指定的键是否不在字典中添加新的键/值对。The example shows that, like the property, the property can change the value associated with an existing key and can be used to add a new key/value pair if the specified key is not in the dictionary. 该示例还表明，与不同属性，属性不会引发异常，如果`key`未在字典中返回空引用改为。The example also shows that unlike the property, the property does not throw an exception if `key` is not in the dictionary, returning a null reference instead. 最后，该示例演示获取属性返回空引用，如果`key`不是正确的数据类型，并设置该属性将引发异常，如果`key`不正确的数据类型。Finally, the example demonstrates that getting the property returns a null reference if `key` is not the correct data type, and that setting the property throws an exception if `key` is not the correct data type. 代码示例摘自一个更大的示例，包括输出中，为提供方法。The code example is part of a larger example, including output, provided for the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法将的功能组合方法和属性。This method combines the functionality of the method and the property. 如果未找到该键，则`value`参数的值类型获取适当的默认值`TValue`; 例如，对于整数类型，0 （零）`false`为布尔值类型和`null`对于引用类型。If the key is not found, then the `value` parameter gets the appropriate default value for the value type `TValue`; for example, 0 (zero) for integer types, `false` for Boolean types, and `null` for reference types. 此方法为 O (log `n`) 操作。This method is an O(log `n`) operation. ## Examples 该示例演示如何使用方法作为更高效的方法来检索经常尝试不在字典中的键的程序中的值。The example shows how to use the method as a more efficient way to retrieve values in a program that frequently tries keys that are not in the dictionary. 与之相反，对于该示例还演示如何将属性 （C# 中的索引器） 在尝试检索不存在的键时引发异常。For contrast, the example also shows how the property (the indexer in C#) throws exceptions when attempting to retrieve nonexistent keys. 此代码示例是为提供一个更大示例的一部分类。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class.
